name: Congenital Ventricular Diverticulum with Arrhythmia
chief_complaint: My child keeps fainting and says their heart feels funny

lab_results.Echocardiogram: thin-walled outpouching from left ventricular apex

prognosis: Guarded; depends on arrhythmia control and diverticulum stability. Risk of sudden cardiac death if untreated.
description: A rare congenital cardiac anomaly where a thin-walled diverticulum protrudes from the ventricular wall, often associated with ventricular arrhythmias due to abnormal electrical pathways. The diverticulum may contain all three myocardial layers but is functionally impaired.
